column1: Reverse Items need to have their numbers the opposite (ie. 1 = 7)
Each Item is categorized, some questions have two categories
Thinking Feeling Acting scores are separate

column2: Item
It's hard for me to notice my thoughts.
I'm good at noticing my feelings and emotions.
I notice myself doing things without paying attention to them.
I can notice my thoughts without letting them affect how I feel.
It's hard for me notice my feelings without letting them control what I do.
I don't get very frustrated or upset when I make mistakes.
It's common that thoughts get stuck in my head.
When I have strong feelings, they only last a short period of time.
I can boost my confidence when I need to.
I'm aware of the situations that challenge my confidence.
I'm confident in my skills and abilities as an athlete.
I'm confident I will achieve my goals.
I lose confidence after a disappointing performance.
I'm driven to learn and master new things.
I care a lot about what others think of me.
I do hard things even when I don't feel like it.
I know what situations challenge my motivation.
I'm aware of my strengths.
I'm aware of my weaknesses.
I'm aware of how I typically think in different situations (i.e., my thinking patterns).
I'm aware of how I typically feel in different situations (i.e., my patterns of emotions)
I'm aware of how I typical act in different situations (i.e., my patterns of behaviour).
I have a clear idea of the values that shape who I am.
I know what I need to do to feel healthy.
I often reflect on my thoughts.
It's hard for me to stay focused under pressure.
I can direct my attention to the things I need to focus on.
It's hard for me to regain focus when I get distracted.
I know where my attention needs to be when I'm performing.
I can keep my attention on a task for the time it needs without getting too distracted.
I can energize myself when I need a boost.
I can calm myself down when I need to.
I know what state I need to be in to perform at my best.
My performance is negatively affected by stress.
I can bounce back quickly when things go wrong.
I find ways to get better after I fail.
I struggle to maintain a positive mindset when things get tough.
I adapt well to change.
I understand how thoughts work and how they impact us.
I understand what emotions are, how they work, and how they impact us.
I understand what habits are, how they work, and how they impact us.
I understand what's within and outside of people's control.
I understand what goes into living a healthy lifestyle.
I have a lot of motivation and desire to bring my best to practice.
I set specific goals for practice.
I consistently bring high levels of effort to practice.
I get a lot of good feedback in practice.
I generally feel good and healthy.
